verbose_text: In this multi-enzymatic approach, l-threonine ammonia lyase catalyzes the deamination of l-threonine to give 2-oxobutyric acid, which is reductively aminated by d-amino acid dehydrogenase with formate dehydrogenase for co-factor regeneration to produce d-2-aminobutyric acid.
evidence: 2-oxobutyric acid, which is reductively aminated by d-amino acid dehydrogenase with formate dehydrogenase for co-factor regeneration to produce d-2-aminobutyric acid
